segment.source: Import an AppLocker policy into a GPO (Windows 10)
segment.target: Import an AppLocker policy into a GPO (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to import an AppLocker policy into a Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to import an AppLocker policy into a Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: Import an AppLocker policy into a GPO
segment.target: Import an AppLocker policy into a GPO

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to import an AppLocker policy into a Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to import an AppLocker policy into a Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: AppLocker policies can be created as local security policies and modified like any other local security policy, or they can be created as part of a GPO and managed by using Group Policy.
segment.target: AppLocker policies can be created as local security policies and modified like any other local security policy, or they can be created as part of a GPO and managed by using Group Policy.

segment.source: You can create AppLocker policies on any supported computer.
segment.target: You can create AppLocker policies on any supported computer.

segment.source: For info about which Windows editions are supported, see Requirements to Use AppLocker.
segment.target: For info about which Windows editions are supported, see Requirements to Use AppLocker.

segment.source: Important: Follow your organization's standard procedures for updating GPOs.
segment.target: Important: Follow your organization's standard procedures for updating GPOs.

segment.source: For info about specific steps to follow for AppLocker policies, see Maintain AppLocker policies.
segment.target: For info about specific steps to follow for AppLocker policies, see Maintain AppLocker policies.

segment.source: To complete this procedure, you must have the Edit Setting permission to edit a GPO.
segment.target: To complete this procedure, you must have the Edit Setting permission to edit a GPO.

segment.source: By default, members of the Domain Admins group, the Enterprise Admins group, and the Group Policy Creator Owners group have this permission.
segment.target: By default, members of the Domain Admins group, the Enterprise Admins group, and the Group Policy Creator Owners group have this permission.

segment.source: To import an AppLocker policy into a GPO
segment.target: To import an AppLocker policy into a GPO

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), open the GPO that you want to edit.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), open the GPO that you want to edit.

segment.source: In the console tree under Computer ConfigurationPoliciesWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsApplication Control Policies, click AppLocker.
segment.target: In the console tree under Computer ConfigurationPoliciesWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsApplication Control Policies, click AppLocker.

segment.source: Right-click AppLocker, and then click Import Policy.
segment.target: Right-click AppLocker, and then click Import Policy.

segment.source: In the Import Policy dialog box, locate the XML policy file, and click Open.
segment.target: In the Import Policy dialog box, locate the XML policy file, and click Open.

segment.source: The AppLocker dialog box will notify you of how many rules were imported.
segment.target: The AppLocker dialog box will notify you of how many rules were imported.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.
